intro: Jacquinia sphaeroidea, commonly known as the globe sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, globular inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense colonies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various wildlife species.
